title: 5.1 audio playing as stereo in Firefox only
content: I have a Windows 11 PC with Creative Sound Blaster Z sound card. The sound card and Windows settings are configured for 5.1 speakers and both test OK for sending sound to all 5.1 speakers correctly. Additionally, I can go to https://www2.iis.fraunhofer.de/AAC/multichannel.html using Chrome or Edge browsers and all the tests play correctly to all of my 5.1 speakers. However when I go to this same site (or any other with 5.1 audio) using Firefox browser, the 5.1 audio only plays in stereo (no audio to center or rear speakers - everything is down-mixed to the front L/R speakers only). I've double-checked that the Mozilla channel in Windows Volume Mixer is configured correctly (for output to the Creative Sound Blaster Z device), and none of the output audio enhancement modes are enabled in the Sound Blaster control panel. Firefox is version 136.0.4. Bottom Line: only Firefox seems to be having trouble playing 5.1 audio correctly. Any ideas what might be wrong or any settings adjustments to try?
creator: lrcmscstf

title: My modem says my version of Mozilla Firefox is unsupported
content: When I log into my modem it sends me a banner notification my "version of Mozilla Firefox is unsupported. Your gateway's web interface has been tested to work with a minimum version of 63.0.3. You may proceed with an unsupported version." However, when I am in my browser, and select Help--> About Firefox--> it shows I am on version 136.0.4 and up to date. When I access my modem, why does my modem say my browser is out of date when it isn't? Does my modem have a different browser version from my computer, and if so, how do I update that? Thanks in advance for any guidance.

title: Performance and Connectivity
content:
I am experiencing significant performance problems in Mozilla Firefox when using certain AI-powered tools. Below are the specific issues: 

   Flux AI & Diagramming AI Performance Warnings 
       Issue: When accessing Flux AI or Diagramming AI tools, Firefox displays a warning message stating, "This site is slowing down Firefox." 
       Observed Behavior: 
           Delayed response times or freezing when interacting with these tools. 
           High CPU usage (observed via Task Manager) when the tools are active. 
       Expected Behavior: Smooth operation without performance degradation, as seen in other browsers (e.g., Chrome or Edge). 
   CMS Sign-Out Failure 
       Issue: Unable to sign out of my Content Management System (CMS). The action either freezes or refreshes without logging me out. 
       Troubleshooting Attempted: Cleared cache/cookies, disabled extensions, tested in Safe Mode—issue persists. 
   ChatGPT Menu Error 
       Issue: Clicking the three-dots (⋮) menu in ChatGPT triggers an error instead of displaying options. 
       Error Context: Mentions "Flux AI," suggesting a possible conflict or integration failure.
creator: basitaliaps

title: Восстановление данных с прошлого профиля.
content:
Здравствуйте, уважаемые firefox.

Недавно переустанавливая в очередной раз Windows столкнулся с проблемой синхронизации моих данных в вашем браузере. Пароли, закладки, журнал и тд не синхронизировалось, а при открытии того самого старого профиля через about:profiles, тоже ничего.

Я был очень опечален данным результатом, так как там хранилось много нужной мне информации. К тому же, удалением профилей или чем-то таким я не занимался. Прошу помочь мне и отправить ответ на почту.

С уважением, doraikesshu@mail.ru
